body: Hey @mfkeles, that looks like a serious memory leak. Thanks for reporting it, I'll see if I can find its cause ðŸ˜Ž

@jeylau Thank you so much!!
For what it's worth, memory issue repeated on [Colab](https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1pt0q7p8JsXKOm2cd-JGmg_Wl1VjuKej4?usp=sharing) as well.
We think this might be an OpenCV memory leak. Could you comment on what frame it fails (and if it consistently fails at the same fraction of your video)?
It doesn't fail at the same frame (or at least the % of analyzed vid).  With 64 gb memory, it fails around 100k (~5%) frames and with lower memory systems (colab) it fails around 20k (~1%).

issue.title: Analyze_videos() creates no output after retraining [colab]

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

After refining labels and retraining the network, we are having a trouble analyzing videos again. When running the analyze_videos() function, the output runs through without any errors:
![Analysis Error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85576484/129796441-c9f2efcd-75b1-4ed1-a162-7f71ad6f7885.PNG)

However, the videos folder (default destination folder; also tried changing the destfolder) contains no .h5, csv, or pickle files. I have tried moving the videos to a different path, converting the .mp4 videos into .MOV or saving to another .mp4, and even retraining the network. I still run into the same issue where the analyze videos goes to completion on all videos in the path but does not output any results. I have used the same method of refining/retraining/analysis in the past for another cohort of animals and didn't run into this problem.

### Operating System

Windows 10/Google Colab

### DeepLabCut version

2.2rc3

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

Google Colab Pro

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Refine and retrain network
2. run analyze_videos() --> no results

### Relevant log output

```shell
Starting to analyze %  /content/drive/Shareddrives/DeepLabCut_SRM_SharedDrive/ProjectFolders/Vanessa_Project_Folders/IKKBetaCA-Pilocarpine-OF_21vids_Atmpt3-VU-2021-07-26/videos/Trial61.mp4
/content/drive/Shareddrives/DeepLabCut_SRM_SharedDrive/ProjectFolders/Vanessa_Project_Folders/IKKBetaCA-Pilocarpine-OF_21vids_Atmpt3-VU-2021-07-26/videos  already exists!
Loading  /content/drive/Shareddrives/DeepLabCut_SRM_SharedDrive/ProjectFolders/Vanessa_Project_Folders/IKKBetaCA-Pilocarpine-OF_21vids_Atmpt3-VU-2021-07-26/videos/Trial61.mp4
Duration of video [s]:  1202.32 , recorded with  25.0 fps!
Overall # of frames:  30058  found with (before cropping) frame dimensions:  1280 960
Starting to extract posture
Cropping based on the x1 = 230 x2 = 695 y1 = 510 y2 = 965. You can adjust the cropping coordinates in the config.yaml file.
The videos are analyzed. Now your research can truly start! 
 You can create labeled videos with 'create_labeled_video'
If the tracking is not satisfactory for some videos, consider expanding the training set. You can use the function 'extract_outlier_frames' to extract a few representative outlier frames.
2021-08-17 20:31:07.791858
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

body:
hey @jeylau , just checking in to see if there is anything I can help with on this! 

Thank you!!!

hey @mfkeles, could you please share the ouput of `conda env export`? I can't observe that behavior with DLC 2.2.0.2 (although nothing has changed much since 2.2). I see constant memory use (i.e., fluctuations of <1%) over 15k frames of a ~1000x1000 RGB video, using either opencv or pyav (although pyav does look a bit more stable by the way). So I suspect a particular package version may cause it ðŸ¤”

hey @jeylau, hmmm, I have tried it on the [google colab ](https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1C5FVySeeyjxOGXQ6cWFdaLMUWtd1iLP0?usp=sharing) with v. 2.2.0.2 and it still runs out of memory around 20k. Here is also the conda env I use on the local machine that gave me the error:

I can confirm that with `    - opencv-python==4.5.3.56
    - opencv-python-headless==4.5.3.56` I still have the constant increase in memory.

@mfkeles could you try the new DLC docker? `pip install deeplabcut-docker` also looking at the conda, it seems you likely upgraded DLC in an old conda, could you try also a fresh conda DEEPLABCUT.yaml?

@mfkeles, I'm not observing anything strange using your environment. What's very odd though is that purely decoding video frames with opencv ran at ~450fps with yours, down from 950+ with mine (with no clear diff between the two).
